pageContext.description: Line of blades continued by slight ridges to the 2 rivet holes, one of which has broken to form a larger hole.  The spearhead is made up of 2 parts brought to the Museum at different times.
pageContext.publications: Point referred to: H.E. Dudley "Early Days in N.W. Lincolnshire", p. 97, fig. 34.no. 7.,C.F.C. Hawkes. Archaeological Journal CIII, 1847, p. 8, Pl. I, no. 7.
pageContext.collection: Scunthorpe Museum, 76.59.1,Donors: Point - Mr. E. J. Coulthurst (B.51); Socket - Mrs. Chafer (Collected by late Mr. B. Naylor) (B.77)
pageContext.toSearch: Burton Upon Stather, Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, UK
